conclusion: To determine whether the two objects have the same velocity at time \( t_1 \), we need to analyze the given information and the graph.

The graph shows the acceleration of both objects as a function of time. The acceleration of object A is represented by the line \( AB \), and the acceleration of object B is represented by the line \( BA \).
At \( t_1 \), the velocity of object A can be determined by the slope of the line \( AB \).
The slope of \( AB \) represents the acceleration of object A at \( t_1 \).
The slope of \( AB \) is positive, indicating that the acceleration of object A is increasing.
At \( t_2 \), the velocity of object A can be determined by the slope of the line \( BA \).
The slope of \( BA \) represents the acceleration of object A at \( t_2 \).
The slope of \( BA \) is negative, indicating that the acceleration of object A is decreasing.
At \( t_1 \), the velocity of object A is positive.
At \( t_2 \), the velocity of object A is negative.
Since the velocity of object A is positive at \( t_1 \) and negative at \( t_2 \), the two objects do not have the same velocity at \( t_1 \).
The final answer is no, the two objects do not have the same velocity at time \( t_1 \).
